heroIntro: Imagine waking to Mediterranean sunshine, your morning coffee overlooking the charming streets of Finestrat, with pristine Blue Flag beaches just a short drive away. This exceptional 3-bedroom town house represents your gateway to the Costa Blanca lifestyle—a genuine Mediterranean escape at an remarkable price point. At €3,602 per square meter, you're acquiring premium specification at 40% less than comparable properties in Spanish island markets, making this not just a holiday home but a genuinely smart investment. Whether you're seeking a sunshine retreat for those grey winters back home or a second home that could generate rental income during peak season (typical earnings around €800 per week), this Finestrat property delivers the lifestyle upgrade you've been envisioning. The established international community here means you'll find English speakers throughout—from your local café to the healthcare professionals ensuring your wellbeing. This is where coastal living meets practical sophistication; where affordable Mediterranean living becomes accessible.
areaSection: Finestrat is a picturesque coastal town perched between the Mediterranean and the Sierra de Aitana mountains, creating a dramatic backdrop for daily life. Located in the heart of Costa Blanca's Golden Mile, Finestrat enjoys over 300 days of guaranteed sunshine annually, with mild winters and warm, sun-soaked summers. The town has evolved from a traditional fishing village into a vibrant residential community while maintaining its authentic Spanish character and charm. The distinctive Balcón de Finestrat viewpoint—literally the town's balcony—offers breathtaking panoramic vistas across the coast. Modern infrastructure seamlessly blends with the town's historic core, featuring contemporary amenities, excellent connectivity, and easy access to major regional attractions. The surrounding region offers championship golf courses, water sports facilities, and some of Spain's most awarded beaches, all within convenient driving distance.
lifestyleSection: Life in Finestrat centers on a relaxed Mediterranean rhythm punctuated by excellent facilities and services. The established international community here means English is widely spoken—your doctor, your banker, your café owner will likely speak your language. Daily life flows between the local markets bursting with fresh produce, modern supermarkets like Mercadona and Lidl for familiar brands, and charming beachfront restaurants serving both traditional paella and international cuisine. The climate enables outdoor living year-round: morning beach swims, afternoon golf rounds, evening paseos through tree-lined streets. Healthcare is comprehensive with English-speaking doctors and private clinics complementing the excellent regional hospital. Your social calendar could include beach clubs, cycling routes through the sierra, or simply the daily ritual of watching the sun set over the Mediterranean. It's a lifestyle that balances activity with relaxation, sophistication with unpretentiousness.
investmentSection: This property sits at an excellent point in the market cycle. Costa Blanca residential values are experiencing steady appreciation at 8% year-on-year, significantly outpacing broader economic inflation. The rental market for holiday properties remains robust—similar 3-bedroom town houses achieve approximately €800 per week during peak season (July-September), with strong shoulder-season occupancy from April through June. At €425,000, this represents exceptional value when compared to equivalent properties on Ibiza or Mallorca, which typically command 60-70% premiums despite comparable specifications. The established tourist infrastructure means consistent vacation rental demand, while the growing international residential community supports long-term appreciation. Whether deployed as a personal retreat generating supplementary income during unused weeks, or maintained as an appreciation asset, this property offers multiple value pathways.
conclusion: This Finestrat town house represents precisely what thoughtful holiday property buyers seek: authentic Mediterranean lifestyle accessible at genuinely reasonable cost, positioned within an established English-speaking community, deployed either as a personal retreat generating substantial supplementary income, or maintained as an appreciating asset in one of Europe's most stable property markets. At €425,000—40% cheaper than equivalent Spanish island alternatives—you're acquiring premium specification at exceptional value. The infrastructure is modern, the climate is predictable, the beaches are minutes away, and the rental income potential is proven. Whether your vision centers on escaping northern winters to guaranteed sunshine, establishing a Mediterranean base for European exploration, or investing in property appreciation while generating vacation rental income, this property delivers on all fronts. faqs.question: Er Costa Blanca et godt sted å kjøpe eiendom?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca represents one of Europe's most attractive property markets for international buyers. The region experiences consistent 8% year-on-year appreciation, benefits from excellent infrastructure and amenities, maintains a strong tourism-driven rental market, and offers exceptional value compared to other Mediterranean destinations. The established expatriate community, English-language services, and proven healthcare systems make it particularly appealing for UK and Northern European investors.

faqs.question: Kan utlendinger kjøpe eiendom i Spania?
faqs.answer: Yes, non-EU and EU citizens can freely purchase Spanish property without restrictions or special permissions. You'll require an NIE (Spanish tax identification number), open a Spanish bank account, and register the property in your name. Most international buyers engage Spanish lawyers specializing in property transactions to navigate paperwork and ensure full legal compliance. The process is straightforward, transparent, and well-established for foreign ownership.

faqs.question: Hva er levekostnadene på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Cost of living in Finestrat is approximately 30-40% lower than equivalent UK expenses, particularly for food, utilities, and services. Supermarket shopping, restaurant meals, and domestic help cost substantially less than northern Europe. Property ownership costs (municipal taxes, utilities) remain minimal compared to UK ownership. Healthcare expenses virtually disappear with access to Spanish public healthcare system. Alcohol and dining represent particularly good value, making the lifestyle genuinely affordable alongside property appreciation.

faqs.question: Kan jeg få boliglån i Spania som utlending?
faqs.answer: Yes, Spanish banks offer mortgages to non-resident foreign buyers, typically providing 60-80% loan-to-value financing at competitive rates (currently 2-4% fixed). You'll require an NIE, proof of income, and a Spanish bank account. Many international property buyers engage mortgage brokers specializing in Spanish finance to compare options across multiple banks. The process is straightforward and increasingly common as Spanish lenders recognize the international buyer market.

faqs.question: Hva koster det å kjøpe eiendom i Spania?
faqs.answer: Spanish property purchases incur approximately 10-12% in additional costs beyond the purchase price. Transfer tax (3-8%) varies by region, legal fees (0.5-1%), property registration (0.5%), and surveyor costs (0.5-1%) are standard. First-time buyers may qualify for reduced transfer tax rates. Ongoing costs include annual municipal property tax (around €100-200 for this property), building insurance, and utility payments. These costs remain significantly lower than equivalent UK property transactions.

faqs.question: Hvor mye er eiendomsskatten i Spania?
faqs.answer: Spanish annual property tax (IBI) for residential properties averages 0.4-0.6% of property value, meaning approximately €200-250 annually for this €425,000 property. This represents extraordinary savings compared to UK council tax or other European property taxes. Additionally, if deployed as a rental property, you'll declare rental income (subject to Spanish income tax), though the generous depreciation allowances (3% annually on construction value) substantially reduce tax liability. Professional tax advisors specializing in property investors can optimize tax efficiency.

faqs.question: Hvordan er været på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys Mediterranean climate with 300+ days of guaranteed annual sunshine, mild winters (15-17°C average), and warm summers (28-32°C). Winter months rarely drop below freezing, making outdoor activity feasible year-round. Rainfall remains minimal, typically concentrated in autumn. The stable, predictable climate enables consistent beach use, golf, and outdoor dining throughout the year—a primary attraction for holiday home buyers seeking reliable sunshine.

faqs.question: Er Costa Blanca bra for pensjonister?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca has established itself as Europe's premier retirement destination, particularly for British and Northern European retirees. Healthcare provision equals or exceeds UK standards, with English-speaking professionals widely available. Cost of living allows generous retirement budgets to stretch significantly further than at home. The established expatriate community provides social infrastructure, English-language services, and familiar amenities. Outdoor lifestyle promotes physical activity and mental wellbeing. Tax implications for UK pension-drawers are favorable, and healthcare provision remains excellent.

faqs.question: Can this property be used as a holiday rental?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. This 3-bedroom townhouse is ideally configured for holiday rental income generation. Similar properties in Finestrat achieve approximately €800 per week during peak season (July-September), with strong occupancy through shoulder seasons (April-June). Online platforms including Airbnb, Booking.com, and specialist Costa Blanca rental agencies provide effortless marketing to international tourists. Many owners use hybrid models: personal use during winter months, rental deployment during summer peak season. The property's location, size, and amenities make it consistently attractive to holiday renters.

faqs.question: Hvor langt er det fra Norge til Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca sits approximately 1,200 kilometers (750 miles) south of the UK, with flight times of 2.5-3 hours from major UK airports. Alicante-Elche Airport, just 45 minutes from this property, hosts numerous daily flights to London, Manchester, Birmingham, Bristol, and Glasgow. Flight costs typically range €40-120 for budget carriers, making regular visits affordable and convenient. Essentially, the Mediterranean is a short flight away—realistic for frequent holiday use, weekend escapes, or seasonal migration.
